data: Contract for the sale of a house and a shop
A lead sheet broken into five main fragments, and with the top, left, and bottom sides lightly damaged.

The left margin is not preserved but the first letters of most lines are preserved; the damage to the top has destroyed some of the text of L.1, and the ancient folds have damaged some of the text body. The right margin is entirely preserved and the bottom margin partially preserved.
Discovered in 1973 before systematic excavations by R. Brugaletta on his property at a place later identified as House 17, Insula A 34.
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered in the province of Ragusa, with a particular focus on the sites of Kaukana, Kamarina, Castiglione and Monte Casasia
Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.
Giacomo Manganaro, «Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.», La Parola del Passato 44 (1989): 189–216
Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l'étude du vocabulaire grec colonial
Laurent Dubois, Inscriptions grecques dialectales de Sicile : contribution à l’étude du vocabulaire grec colonial, CEFR 119 (Rome: Ecole française de Rome, 1989)
Manganaro, 1989, Case e terra a Kamarina e Morgantina nel III–II sec. a.C.
contract for the sale of a house and a shop

2Δίνα[ρχος] Κλεάνδρου Σω[σί]στρατ[ο]ς Θέωον[ο]ς νή(τα) πρ(ῶτα) ἐπρίατο οἴκησιν καὶ
3τὰ<ν> καπη[λ]είαν τὰν Δίων[ος] πᾶσαν καὶ τὰ θυρώματα τοίχους κοινοὺς
4ποτὶ Φιλόξενον καὶ Θράσυλλ<ο>ν λαύρα[ι] Περγάου καὶ Φ[ε]ρσ{σσ}οφάσας
5πὰρ Δίωνος τοῦ Ἡρακλεί\δ̣/α τέ(τρατα) πρ(ῶτα) τετρώκοντα ταλάντων Ἄμποχοι

7Ἀρταμίδωρος Ἡρακλεί[δ]α τέ(ταρτα) πρ(ῶτα) Παυσανίας Σωσικτράτεος νή(τα) πρ(ῶτα)
8Ἡράκλειος Νίκωνος τρ(ίτα) [π]ρῶ(τα) Σάννω[ν] Ζωπύρου τέτρα(τα) πρῶ(τα)
9Σῖμος Γ[ε]λώιου νή(τα) πρ(ῶτα) Μύων Εὐθυμ̣ένεος ἑκτ(α) πρῶτ(α)
10Θεύδω[ρ]ος Δάμονος ἑκ(τα) πρ(ῶτα) \ΔΦ/ Γέλων Καλλιστράτου ἑκτ(α) πρῶ(τα)

10ΘΕΥΔΩ[.]ΟΣΔΑΜΟΝΟΣΕΚΠΡ\ΔΦ/ΓΕΛΩΝΚΑΛΛΙΣΤΡΑΤΟΥΕΚΤΠΡΩ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text based on Cordano in Boll. Art. 1984 and Manganaro in Parola del Passato 1989;
  • 2: νη. πρ., C.; throughout the text C. does not expand the abbreviations as M. does.
  • 3: τὰ(ν), M.
  • 4: Θράσυλλον, M.λαύρα [.]πὲρ Γάου, C. and D. but the dative proposed by M. would appear to be more correct.Φερσσοφάσας, M., but the sheet clearly has three sigmas from the drawing of U. Lazzarini and G. Foglia printed in Cordano 1984.
  • 8: πρῶ(τα), M.Σάννων, M.

English translation

Randall Souza

When ------- was in office, on the sixth of Heraios, Dinarchos son of Kleandros was president of the supervisors of contracts. Sosistratos son of Theon, last (phratry)-first (tribe), bought the house and the whole business of Dion and the doorways, the walls shared with Philoxenos and Thrasyllos, in the district of Pergaos and Phersophasa, from Dion son of Herakleidas, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), for forty talents. Guarantors: Ariston son of Emmenidas, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Philippos son of Pausanias, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Artamidoros son of Herakleidas, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), Pausanias son of Sosikrates, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Herakleios son of Nikon, third (phrary)-first (tribe), Sannon son of Zopuros, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), Simos son of Geloios, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Muon son of Euthumenes, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe), Theudorods son of Damon, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe), Gelon son of Kallistratos, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe).

A lead sheet broken into five main fragments, and with the top, left, and bottom sides lightly damaged.

Lead lamina 9 13.8 0.1

The left margin is not preserved but the first letters of most lines are preserved; the damage to the top has destroyed some of the text of L.1, and the ancient folds have damaged some of the text body. The right margin is entirely preserved and the bottom margin partially preserved.

engraved

Four-bar sigma, two-bar upsilon, dotted theta, pi with short right bar, small omicron

Ἐπὶ eponym in genitive case Ἡραίου ἕκται ἱσταμένου συναλλακτήρων προστάτας Δίναρχος Κλεάνδρου Σωσίστρατος Θέωονος νήτα πρῶτα ἐπρίατο οἴκησιν καὶ τὰν καπηλείαν τὰν Δίωνος πᾶσαν καὶ τὰ θυρώματα τοίχους κοινοὺς ποτὶ Φιλόξενον καὶ Θράσυλλον λαύραι Περγάου καὶ Φερσσσοφάσας πὰρ Δίωνος τοῦ Ἡρακλείδα τέτρατα πρῶτα τετρώκοντα ταλάντων Ἄμποχοι Ἀρίστων Ἐμμενίδα νήτα πρῶτα Φίλιππος Παυσανία νήτα πρῶτα Ἀρταμίδωρος Ἡρακλείδα τέταρτα πρῶτα Παυσανίας Σωσικτράτεος νήτα πρῶτα Ἡράκλειος Νίκωνος τρίτα πρῶτα Σάννων Ζωπύρου τέτρατα πρῶτα Σῖμος Γελώιου νήτα πρῶτα Μύων Εὐθυμένεος ἑκτα πρῶτα Θεύδωρος Δάμονος ἑκτα πρῶτα ΔΦ Γέλων Καλλιστράτου ἑκτα πρῶτα

Θράσυλλον, M.λαύρα ὑπὲρ Γάου, C. and D. but the dative proposed by M. would appear to be more correct.Φερσσοφάσας, M., but the sheet clearly has three sigmas from the drawing of U. Lazzarini and G. Foglia printed in Cordano 1984. πρῶ(τα), M.Σάννων, M.

When ------- was in office, on the sixth of Heraios, Dinarchos son of Kleandros was president of the supervisors of contracts. Sosistratos son of Theon, last (phratry)-first (tribe), bought the house and the whole business of Dion and the doorways, the walls shared with Philoxenos and Thrasyllos, in the district of Pergaos and Phersophasa, from Dion son of Herakleidas, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), for forty talents. Guarantors: Ariston son of Emmenidas, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Philippos son of Pausanias, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Artamidoros son of Herakleidas, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), Pausanias son of Sosikrates, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Herakleios son of Nikon, third (phrary)-first (tribe), Sannon son of Zopuros, fourth (phratry)-first (tribe), Simos son of Geloios, last (phratry)-first (tribe), Muon son of Euthumenes, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe), Theudorods son of Damon, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe), Gelon son of Kallistratos, sixth (phratry)-first (tribe).
